pageContext.analysis: According to data from the U.S. Census Bureau, only 32 percent of Americans are saving for retirement in a 401(k), with many people either working for an employer who does not offer it or choosing not to participate. (One in seven companies offer a 401(k) plan.) Only 55 percent of Americans have any investments in the stock market, according to a Gallup poll, which is a decline from before the Great Recession. Trump often bragged 401-k accounts would not have risen sharply if Hillary Clinton had won in 2016 but then the coronavirus pandemic in early 2020 wiped out much of the gains during Trump's presidency before recovering by year's end.
